name: scratchily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes an unpleasant noise, like something sharp rubbing on a hard surface, or a record with scratches on it (= marks made by something sharp): He scribbled scratchily on a large sheet of paper. The songs that boomed scratchily from radios kept them awake all night.
in a way that rubs uncomfortably on your skin or other part of your body: The chair was scratchily upholstered in cheap fabric. His eyes felt scratchily dry.
More examplesFewer examplesThe music was played rather scratchily by the orchestra.The train's intercom scratchily announced the next stop.She listened to the birds twittering scratchily in the trees.A song was blaring scratchily from the speakers. The bird climbed scratchily onto her arm.
